alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 14 at 11:19AM EST until February 17 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Withlacoochee River above Valdosta (Skipper Bridge Rd) affecting Lowndes and Brooks Counties. For the Withlacoochee River...including Valdosta (Skipper Bridge Rd)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Withlacoochee River above Valdosta (Skipper Bridge Rd). * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 137.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Tuesday was 137.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 137.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 135.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 137.6 feet on 04/21/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 530 AM EST.
